title: Jess Glasgow is comforted by his father as he takes calls from the media about his The Bachelorette
text:
Jess Glasgow has had a rough time since he was booted from The Bachelorette on Thursday night.

And on Friday, the disgraced politician was comforted by his father John as he took calls from the media about his behaviour on the show.

Despite the negative attention, Jess seemed to be in good spirits, beaming as he wrapped his arm around his father's shoulder.

Family first! The Bachelorette's 'Dirty Jess' Glasgow (right) twas comforted by his father John (left) as he took media calls about his sexist comments on the show on Friday

The Noosa Councillor appeared to have a chuckle during on a call while his father flicked through his own smartphone.

Jess is very close with his father as he was an only child who was solely raised by John without a mother in his life.

Speaking to Daily Mail Australia, Jess said his 87-year-old grandmother was 'struggling' with her son's Bachelorette scandal.

Father and son: Jess is very close with his father as he was an only child who was solely raised by him, without a mother in his life

Can I go now Jess? Eventually, John appeared to be bored by his son's antics.

On Thursday night's episode of The Bachelorette, Jess joked that Angie was going to 'ride' him and brazenly told her he 'might get some wandering fingers'.

During a farmyard-themed photo shoot, he positioned his head next to Angie's bottom and proceeded to poke his tongue out and make rude gestures.

Later in the episode, he called Angie a 'b**ch*' after being told she wanted to speak to him about his inappropriate behaviour on set.

Over the past 24 hours, he has faced calls to resign from Noosa Mayor Tony Wellington, who has described his behaviour on The Bachelorette 'misogynistic' and 'highly offensive'.

Too far: During a farmyard-themed photo shoot, Jess positioned his head next to Angie's bottom and proceeded to poke his tongue out and make rude gestures (pictured)

Jess has also been supported by his girlfriend Mandy Lopez, who he met in a bar after being eliminated from The Bachelorette.

He described his girlfriend as his 'light at the end of the tunnel', but admitted that she 'cringed' at some of his behaviour on The Bachelorette.

'I wouldn't be surprised if she left me. It's not the kind of attention you want. If I were her, I would leave me,' he added.
description: Jess Glasgow has had a rough time since he was booted from The Bachelorette on Thursday night.
authors: Shive Prema For Daily Mail Australia
